page.title: 06Woodland continued.
page.content: The area around the Tarn is also well wooded, beech again being the commonest tree, followed by oak, scots pine and silver birch. This year, under the direction of the Warden, school children have helped to plant five thousand young trees, mainly beech and oak, to replace trees blown down in gale three years ago. Between Milton Hall and Tarn Road, along the 'Dandy' - an old railway track - is a large plantation of conifers, mainly Norway spruce, with broad leaved trees bordering the wood. Some felling and replanting is done. A much smaller stand of conifers can be seen between Milton and Farlam. In the last ten years,{Dutch Elm {disease}has been spreading in the area and already a number of Elms have succumbed.
